image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Donald Trump taps loyalist Pam Bondi for US attorney general after Matt Gaetz withdraws
item.description: Pam Bondi has been named as US Attorney General by Donald Trump, succeeding Matt Gaetz, who withdrew amid a federal investigation. Bondi, a staunch Trump ally, previously defended him in his first impeachment trial and supported him during his recent hush money trial. Trump praised Bondi's commitment and outlined his vision for the Department of Justice to prioritise crime fighting and national security.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US regulators seek to break up Google, forcing Chrome sale as monopoly penalty
Prince Harry jokes about getting a tattoo on his a** in hilarious video with singer Jelly Roll
item.description: Prince Harry teamed up with country singer Jelly Roll for a playful promotional video for the upcoming Invictus Games. The video features Harry pretending to get his first tattoo from Jelly Roll, who jokingly inks "I am Jelly Roll" on Harry's neck. The lighthearted exchange promotes Jelly Roll's performance at the Games' closing ceremony in Vancouver in February 2025.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How pollster Nate Silver's claim about JD Vance being venture capitalist Peter Thiel's 'worst' political bet turned out to be wrong?
item.description: A resurfaced video shows Nate Silver and Ezra Klein discussing Peter Thiel's political bets, particularly focusing on JD Vance. They speculated that Vance might be Thiel's worst political bet. However, Vance's vice-presidential win alongside Trump's victory challenges their claim, highlighting Thiel's successful investment in Vance's political journey.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine claims Russia fired ICBM; mid-range missile, says Putin
Top controversies of Matt Gaetz: From inviting an internet troll to Trump's address to personal attack on Michael Cohenâ€‹
item.description: Matt Gaetz withdrew from consideration as Donald Trump's attorney general, citing ongoing federal sex trafficking investigations as a distraction. Gaetz, known for courting controversy, has faced scrutiny for various actions, including inviting an internet troll to Trump's State of the Union address and personal attacks on political opponents.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Daniel Penny, the Marine veteran on trial for manslaughter in New York subway?
item.description: A New York City courtroom is the setting for a high-profile manslaughter trial of Daniel Penny, a former Marine charged in the death of Jordan Neely, a homeless man. Penny restrained Neely in a fatal chokehold during an altercation on a subway train, sparking fierce debate about vigilantism and public safety.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US: 2 Florida officers dead, 1 injured after suv hit their motocycles
item.description: Tragedy struck western Palm Beach County Thursday morning when an SUV collided with motorcycles ridden by law enforcement officers. Two officers lost their lives, and another sustained critical injuries. The accident, which took place on Southern Boulevard near Lion Country Safari, has caused road closures, prompting authorities to urge drivers to seek alternate routes as investigations continue.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs raped a man while talking 'dirty' and wearing a 'disturbing smile,' says lawsuit
item.description: Music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs is facing fresh allegations of sexual assault, including rape accusations from a man who claims he was drugged and assaulted at a 2022 Miami house party. The lawsuit alleges Combs spoke explicitly and smiled disturbingly during the alleged assault.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Santino Pietrosanti, creator of Jaguar's 'woke' ad that has sparked major row
item.description: Jaguar, the British car company, faced criticism for its latest advertisement campaign, "Copy Nothing," which features models instead of cars. Santino Pietrosanti, Jaguar's head of brand, defended the rebranding as a celebration of diversity and originality. While some praised the move, others criticized it as pandering to a "woke" agenda.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk denies Time magazine's cover page checklist featuring him: 'I am trying to make life multiplanetary'
item.description: Elon Musk refuted a Time magazine cover story featuring a "to-do list" attributed to him, clarifying he gave no interviews nor confirmed the listed items. Musk emphasized his main focus remains on making life multiplanetary to extend consciousness's potential lifespan, noting some items on the list align with that goal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chicago bar owners rally against Mayor Johnson over proposed 35% liquor tax hike
item.description: Chicago bar and restaurant owners are protesting Mayor Brandon Johnson's proposed 35% liquor tax hike, arguing it will cripple businesses already struggling with inflation and the pandemic's aftermath. They warn the increase will burden consumers and benefit suburban competitors while failing to meaningfully address the city's budget deficit.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump picks ex congressman Pete Hoekstra as ambassador to Canada
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has nominated former Congressman Pete Hoekstra as the United States Ambassador to Canada. Hoekstra, who previously served as US Ambassador to the Netherlands during Trump's first term, expressed honor at the nomination.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia launches ICBM strike against Ukraine as war escalates
item.description: Russia launched an ICBM from the Astrakhan region, targeting Dnipro in Ukraine. This marks the first use of such a weapon in the ongoing conflict. The attack, which also involved Kh-101 cruise missiles, follows Ukraine's use of Western-supplied long-range missiles against targets within Russia. Moscow had previously warned that such actions would be considered a major escalation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Want asylum before Trump takes power': Migrants set out from Mexico hoping to reach pre-Don US
item.description: Driven by anxiety over Donald Trump's impending presidency and his stringent immigration policies, a large group of approximately 1,500 migrants have embarked on a grueling journey from Tapachula, Mexico. Their goal is to reach the US border and seek asylum before Trump assumes office in January.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
